### v1.0.0 - Initial release - Astrophotography image management - Plate solving integration - Equipment tracking - Immich synchronization
Container.Overview: Skymmich is a comprehensive astrophotography image management and analysis application that bridges the gap between your astrophotography sessions and organized digital asset management. It provides seamless integration with Immich for photo management, advanced plate solving through Astrometry.net, and detailed equipment tracking to help you organize and analyze your celestial captures.
Container.Description:
Skymmich is a comprehensive astrophotography image management and analysis application. It provides automatic synchronization with Immich, plate solving capabilities through Astrometry.net, equipment tracking, and detailed image metadata management. Perfect for organizing and analyzing your astrophotography collection.
Features: - Automatic Immich synchronization - Configurable plate solving with Astrometry.net - Equipment and settings tracking - Image tagging and filtering - Real-time progress updates - Dark theme optimized for astronomy - Secure configuration management - Advanced plate solving configuration options
Requirements: - PostgreSQL database (REQUIRED - install any PostgreSQL template first with database name 'skymmich', username 'skymmich', and a strong password) - Optional: Immich server for photo management - Optional: Astrometry.net API key for plate solving
Security Notes: - API keys are stored securely as environment variables - No secrets are embedded in the container image - Configuration can also be managed via the admin web interface - Always use strong, unique passwords for database connections
Plate Solving Configuration: - Worker check interval: How often the worker checks for new jobs (10-300 seconds) [WORKER ONLY] - Active polling interval: How often to poll when waiting for completion (1-60 seconds) [WORKER ONLY] - Max concurrent jobs: Maximum simultaneous jobs (1-10) [WORKER ONLY] - Auto-resubmit: Whether to automatically retry failed jobs (default: disabled) [WORKER ONLY]
Worker Mode: - The plate solving worker runs as a background process within the container - Worker-only settings only affect the background plate solving process - These settings can also be configured through the admin web interface

Config.Name: Database URL
Config.Description: PostgreSQL connection string (ensure PostgreSQL container is installed first)

Config.Name: Immich API Key
Config.Description: Immich API key for integration (can also be configured via admin interface)

Config.Name: Astrometry API Key
Config.Description: Astrometry.net API key for plate solving (can also be configured via admin interface)

Config.Name: Enable Plate Solving
Config.Description: Enable background plate solving worker [WORKER ONLY]

Config.Name: Worker Check Interval (seconds)
Config.Description: How often the worker checks for new jobs and updates existing ones (10-300 seconds) [WORKER ONLY]

Config.Name: Active Polling Interval (seconds)
Config.Description: How often to poll when actively waiting for job completion (1-60 seconds) [WORKER ONLY]

Config.Name: Max Concurrent Jobs
Config.Description: Maximum number of plate solving jobs to run simultaneously (1-10) [WORKER ONLY]

Config.Name: Auto-resubmit Failed Jobs
Config.Description: When enabled, failed jobs will be automatically retried. When disabled, failed jobs must be manually resubmitted [WORKER ONLY]
